pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:0.4.eng: The training rule on readmitting one who has been ejected

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī bhaṇḍanakārikā hoti kalahakārikā vivādakārikā bhassakārikā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was quarrelsome and argumentative, and she created legal issues in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.3.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī tassā kamme karīyamāne paṭikkosati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.3.eng: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā objected.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī gāmakaṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards Thullanandā went to a village on some business.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.6.pli: “thullanandā bhikkhunī pakkantā”ti, caṇḍakāḷiṃ bhikkhuniṃ āpattiyā adassane ukkhipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.6.eng: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not recognizing an offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.7.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī gāmake taṃ karaṇīyaṃ tīretvā punadeva sāvatthiṃ paccāgacchi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.7.eng: When Thullanandā had finished her business in that village, she returned to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.8.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā āgacchantiyā neva āsanaṃ paññapesi na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakaṭhalikaṃ upanikkhipi na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi na pānīyena āpucchi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.8.eng: On her return, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, or water for washing the feet; and she did not go out to meet her to receive her bowl and robe, nor ask whether she wanted water to drink.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.10.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, ayye, mayi āgacchantiyā neva āsanaṃ paññapesi na pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakaṭhalikaṃ upanikkhipi na paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi na pānīyena āpucchī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.10.eng: why she was acting like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.11.eng: She replied, “That’s how it is, Venerable, when you don’t have a protector.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.12.eng: “But how is it, Venerable, that you don’t have a protector?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.14.pli: ‘ayaṃ anāthā appaññātā, natthi imissā kāci paṭivattā’ti, āpattiyā adassane ukkhipiṃsū”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.14.eng: that no one would speak up for me because I am not esteemed by them and I didn’t have a protector, they ejected me for not recognizing an offense.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.16.pli: “bālā etā abyattā etā, neva jānanti kammaṃ vā kammadosaṃ vā kammavipattiṃ vā kammasampattiṃ vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.16.eng: “They are incompetent fools. They don’t know about legal procedures or their flaws, nor what makes them fail or succeed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.17.pli: Mayaṃ kho jānāma kammampi kammadosampi kammavipattimpi kammasampattimpi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.17.eng: But we know all these things.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.18.pli: Mayaṃ kho akataṃ vā kammaṃ kāreyyāma kataṃ vā kammaṃ kopeyyāmā”ti, lahuṃ lahuṃ bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ sannipātetvā caṇḍakāḷiṃ bhikkhuniṃ osāresi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.18.eng: We can get legal procedures done that haven’t been done, and we can get procedures that have been done overturned.” And she quickly gathered a sangha of nuns and readmitted the nun Caṇḍakāḷī.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.19.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.19.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.20.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāressatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.20.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā readmit a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.21.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāretī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.21.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.24.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāressati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.24.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā readmit a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.26.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.27.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāreyya, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.27.1.eng: ‘If a nun, without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community, readmits a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law and the Teacher’s instruction, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.6.eng: those belonging to the same Buddhist sect and staying within the same monastery zone.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.8.pli: āpattiyā adassane vā appaṭikamme vā appaṭinissagge vā ukkhittā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.8.eng: who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense, for not making amends, or for not giving up a bad view.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.9.eng: In accordance with the Teaching and the Monastic Law:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.10.eng: in accordance with that Teaching, in accordance with that Monastic Law.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.10.comm: Sp 2.669: Dhammenāti bhūtena vatthunā. Vinayenāti codetvā sāretvā. Padabhājanaṁ panassa “yena dhammena yena vinayena ukkhitto suukkhitto hotī”ti imaṁadhippāyamattaṁ dassetuṁ vuttaṁ, “Dhammena: according to truth, according to the rule. Vinayena: having accused, having reminded. But the word analysis is spoken to show just this meaning: ‘Yena dhammena yena vinayena means ejected, properly ejected.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.11.eng: In accordance with the Teacher’s instruction:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.12.eng: in accordance with the Victor’s instruction, in accordance with the Buddha’s instruction.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.13.eng: Without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.14.eng: without having asked permission of the Sangha that did the legal procedure of ejection.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.15.eng: Without the consent of the community:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.16.eng: without being aware of any consent from the community.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.17.pli: “Osāressāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.17.eng: If, intending to readmit her, she searches for a group or establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.18.pli: Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā, kammavācāpariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.18.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense. When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.18.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.20.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.22.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.24.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.26.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she readmits her, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she readmits her, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she readmits her, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.2.eng: if she readmits her after getting permission from the Sangha that did the procedure;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.3.eng: if she readmits her with the consent of the community;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.4.eng: if she readmits one who is behaving properly;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.5.eng: if she readmits her when the Sangha that did the procedure is unavailable;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.5.comm: Asanta can mean “non-existent”, but in this kind of context it often means “unavailable”. See for instance Bu Pc 46:6.1.11, Bu Pc 85:5.1.7 and Bi Pc 51:4.3.3.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.3.8.eng: The fourth offense entailing suspension is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:0.4.eng: The training rule on receiving food

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.2.eng: At that time there was a beautiful nun called Sundarīnandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.3.pli: Manussā bhattagge sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ passitvā avassutā avassutāya sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā aggamaggāni bhojanāni denti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.3.eng: When people saw her in the dining hall, they gave her the best food, both the donors and the recipient having lust.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.4.eng: Sundarīnandā ate as much as she liked,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.5.eng: but not so the other nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā sundarīnandā avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādissati bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.7.eng: “How could Venerable Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati bhuñjatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Sundarīnandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādissati bhuñjissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.11.eng: “How could Sundarīnandā, being lustful, eat either fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a lustful nun eats fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.6.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.8.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.10.pli: manussapuriso, na yakkho na peto na tiracchānagato, viññū paṭibalo sārajjituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.10.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of having lust.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.12.pli: pañca bhojanāni udakadantaponaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.12.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, water, and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “fresh food”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.12.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “fresh food” for khādanīya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.14.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.14.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.14.comm: For a discussion of the renderings “cooked food” for bhojanīya and “flour products” for sattu, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.15.eng: If she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.16.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.18.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.20.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.22.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.1.24.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.1.eng: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.2.eng: If only the man has lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.2.comm: As with Bi Pj 5:2.2.15.1 above, the Pali just says that, “One of them has lust”, ekatoavassute, without specifying who. In this rule, however, the non-offense clause specifically says that there is no offense if the nun knows that the man does not have lust, and so the state of mind of the nun does not seem to be an issue. It follows that “one of them has lust” must refer to the man. This understanding is supported by Sp 2.701: Ekato avassuteti ettha “bhikkhuniyā avassutabhāvo daṭṭhabbo”ti mahāpaccariyaṁ vuttaṁ. Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṁ panetaṁ na vuttaṁ, taṁ pāḷiyā sameti, “‘One of them has lust’: In regard to this it is said in the Mahāpaccarī, ‘There being lust in the nun is to be understood.’ But this is not said in the Mahāaṭṭhakathā, and this agrees with the Canonical text.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.3.eng: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.4.eng: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.5.pli: Ubhatoavassute yakkhassa vā petassa vā paṇḍakassa vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahassa vā hatthato “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.5.eng: If both of them have lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it directly from a male spirit, a male ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.6.eng: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.7.eng: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.8.eng: If only the male being has lust, and she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.9.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.2.10.eng: If she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.3.eng: if she receives, knowing that the man has no lust;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss5:2.3.6.eng: The fifth offense entailing suspension is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:0.4.eng: The second training rule on receiving food

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sundarīnandā bhikkhunī abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.2.eng: At that time there was a beautiful nun called Sundarīnandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.3.pli: Manussā bhattagge sundarīnandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ passitvā avassutā sundarīnandāya bhikkhuniyā aggamaggāni bhojanāni denti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.3.eng: When people saw her in the dining hall, they were affected by lust, and they gave her the best food.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.4.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, Sundarīnandā did not receive it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.5.eng: The nun next to her said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.10.pli: “Kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.10.eng: “What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.11.pli: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā, bhuñja vā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.11.eng: Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands, and eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.12.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.12.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.14.pli: ‘kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.14.eng: ‘What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.15.pli: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā’”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.15.eng: Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands, and eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you’?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun said this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.17.pli: ‘kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā yato tvaṃ anavassutā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.18.pli: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā’”ti?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.21.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī evaṃ vakkhati—

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.22.pli: ‘kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā yato tvaṃ anavassutā;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.23.pli: iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā’ti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.25.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.25.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.26.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī evaṃ vadeyya— ‘kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā’ti, ayampi bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:1.26.1.eng: ‘If a nun says, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,” then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.6.pli: “kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.6.eng: if she urges her on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, Venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,” then she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.7.pli: Tassā vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.7.eng: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.8.eng: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.9.eng: At the end of the meal, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.11.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.13.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.15.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1.17.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.1.eng: If she urges her on to receive water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.2.pli: Tassā vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.2.eng: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.3.pli: Ekatoavassute yakkhassa vā petassa vā paṇḍakassa vā tiracchānagatamanussaviggahassa vā hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā “khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.3.eng: If, when only the male being has lust, she urges her on to eat fresh or cooked food received directly from a male spirit, a male ghost, a paṇḍaka, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.3.comm: As with Bi Pj 5:2.2.15.1 and Bi Ss 5:2.2.2, the Pali just says that “One of them has lust”, ekatoavassute, without specifying who. Yet as with Bi Ss 5, the non-offense clause specifically says that there is no offense if the nun knows that the man or the male being does not have lust, and so the state of mind of the nun does not seem to be an issue. It follows that “one of them has lust” must refer to the male being. This understanding is supported by Sp 2.701: Ekato avassuteti ettha “bhikkhuniyā avassutabhāvo daṭṭhabbo”ti mahāpaccariyaṁ vuttaṁ. Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṁ panetaṁ na vuttaṁ, taṁ pāḷiyā sameti, “‘One of them has lust’: In regard to this it is said in the Mahāpaccarī, ‘There being lust in the nun is to be understood.’ But this is not said in the Mahāaṭṭhakathā, and this agrees with the Canonical text.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.4.pli: Tassā vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.4.eng: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.5.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.6.eng: At the end of the meal, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.7.eng: If she urges her on to receive water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.8.pli: Tassā vacanena “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.2.8.eng: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.2.eng: if she urges her on, knowing that he has no lust;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.3.eng: if she urges her on, thinking that she is not receiving because of anger;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.4.eng: if she urges her on, thinking that she is not receiving because of compassion for the family;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.7.eng: The sixth offense entailing suspension is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.3.7.comm: The nuns’ offenses entailing suspension 7, 8, and 9 are identical to Bu Ss 5:2.2.13.1, Bu Ss 8:1.9.32.1, and Bu Ss 9:1.2.14.1 respectively.
